page.title: 08INDUSTRY: Waterloo/Tandem
page.content:
{Sykes and Tunnicliffe}was founded in 1898. Now in Almondbury it is a large producer of woven fireside rugs. It employs fewer people now (42) due to modernisation. Although some employees are local people, more come from outside the area than in the past.
{Gelpack}opened in 1981 and now employs 138 full-time and 17 part-time. They work 8 hours a day (40 hours weekly). The factory makes disposable household plastic bags, e.g. those sold in supermarkets. Much of the manufacture is done by machines.
{Standard Fireworks}now make flares for farmers. These are on long lengths of rope. At night the farmer lights the rope and it burns at a steady rate. Then, at dawn, a flare is set off. This scares off the birds.
